intro: Oxydectes polycarpa, commonly known as the many-fruited oxydectes, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release numerous small seeds, aiding in its dispersal.
